item.title: Decision Trees
item.description: HUGOMORE42 Decision trees Decision trees area tree-like tool which can be used to represent a cause and its effect. In Machine Learning Decision trees are a type of Supervised machine learning where data is split according to given parameter while constructing a tree to solve a given problem. In decision tree there is a predictor variable and target variable or the desired output. The predictor variable could be anything such as technical indicators etc and the target variable could be desired output for example whether to invest in a given financial security or not.

item.title: Logistic Regression in ML
item.description: HUGOMORE42 Logistic Regression Introduction Logistic regression is a classification algorithm used to assign observations to a discrete set of classes. Unlike linear regression which outputs continuous number values, logistic regression transforms its output using the logistic sigmoid function to return a probability value which can then be mapped to two or more discrete classes. item.title: Proportion test in R

Mean \(\bar{x} = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} x_i }\) $$(\bar{x} = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} x_i })$$ population variance \(\sigma^2 = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }\) $$(\sigma^2 = {\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 })$$ sample variance \(s^2 = {\frac{1}{n - 1} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }\) $$(s^2 = {\frac{1}{n - 1} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 })$$ Population Standard Deviation \(\sigma = \sqrt{\sigma^2} = \sqrt{{\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }}\) $$(\sigma = \sqrt{\sigma^2} = \sqrt{{\frac{1}{n} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} (x_i - \bar{x})^2 }})$$
